docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 2 -- One of the primary objectives of the United Nations in this war is to guarantee for coming generations "a legacy of peace and brotherhood untrammeled by the threats and fears of greed and brute force," Breckinridge Long,...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 2 -- One of the primary objectives of the United Nations in this war is to guarantee for coming generations "a legacy of peace and brotherhood untrammeled by the threats and fears of greed and brute force," Breckinridge Long, Assistant Secretary of State, declared in opening the eighth Pan-American Child Congress today.
docs.abstract: Roosevelt message read by Asst Sec Long; delegates plan child health and welfare collaboration

docs.snippet: The Free World Association will hold an international conference at the Hotel Commodore next Friday, at which 200 Free World leaders from the four quarters of the globe will attend for the purpose of spreading its counter-campaign against fascism and...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Free World Association will hold an international conference at the Hotel Commodore next Friday, at which 200 Free World leaders from the four quarters of the globe will attend for the purpose of spreading its counter-campaign against fascism and nazism throughout the world.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 6 -- Victory in war and a brighter future in the peace to follow it were predicted at tonight's White House session of the Pan-American Child Congress by Dr. Enrique Saladrigas, chairman of the Cuban delegation, in his opening address...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 6 -- Victory in war and a brighter future in the peace to follow it were predicted at tonight's White House session of the Pan-American Child Congress by Dr. Enrique Saladrigas, chairman of the Cuban delegation, in his opening address to the delegates following their reception by Mrs. Franklin D. Roosevelt.

docs.snippet: The following release was issued yesterday by the State Department covering the departure of the Drottningholm with Axis diplomats. The department requested that no further information of the sailing, gathered locally or elsewhere, be added.

docs.snippet: CARACAS, Venezuela, May 3 -- Production of petroleum in Venezuela in 1941 exceeded that of any previous year in the country's history, soaring to more than thirty-three million metric tons and placing the country second among the world's...
docs.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela, May 3 -- Production of petroleum in Venezuela in 1941 exceeded that of any previous year in the country's history, soaring to more than thirty-three million metric tons and placing the country second among the world's oil-producing nations, it is revealed in the annual report of the Ministry of Development.
docs.abstract: Venezuelan Development Ministry compares nations' output, 1941
